title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0001
text: What is the main purpose of third-party registration in microservices service discovery?

options.text: To delegate service registration to an external component
To allow services to register themselves
To let clients manually register services

explanation: Third-party registration delegates the responsibility of registering and deregistering services to an external component such as an orchestrator or agent.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0002
text: Which component typically handles registration in third-party registration?
explanation: In third-party registration, an external service or agent handles the registration and deregistration of service instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0003
text: Which of the following best describes the workflow of third-party registration?

options.text: External agent detects service → Registers it → Monitors health
Service starts → Registers itself → Sends heartbeats
Client starts → Registers service → Sends requests
Registry starts → Registers all services manually

explanation: In third-party registration, an external agent detects running services, registers them, and monitors their health.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a common tool that supports third-party registration?
explanation: Kubernetes supports third-party registration by automatically managing service registration through its control plane.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of third-party registration?

options.text: Simplifies service logic by offloading registration
Requires each service to manage registration
Eliminates the need for a registry

explanation: Third-party registration simplifies service logic by offloading registration responsibilities to an external component.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of third-party registration?
explanation: Third-party registration introduces dependency on external components like orchestrators or agents.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a key responsibility of the third-party component?

options.text: Registering and deregistering services with the registry

explanation: The third-party component is responsible for registering and deregistering services with the registry.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a benefit of third-party registration for automation?

options.text: Automatically registers services when they start

explanation: Third-party registration automates service registration when new instances start.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a benefit of third-party registration for scalability?
explanation: Third-party registration supports dynamic scaling by automatically registering new instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a challenge of third-party registration?

options.text: External component must remain highly available

explanation: The external component must remain highly available to ensure continuous registration and discovery.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a benefit of third-party registration for fault tolerance?
explanation: Third-party registration improves fault tolerance by automatically deregistering failed instances.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a common health check mechanism used in third-party registration?
explanation: Third-party registration often uses agent-based health monitoring to track service health.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of third-party registration for maintainability?

options.text: Centralizes registration logic in one component

explanation: Third-party registration centralizes registration logic, simplifying maintenance and updates.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a benefit of third-party registration for reliability?

options.text: Ensures registry always reflects active instances

explanation: Third-party registration ensures the registry always reflects active instances through automated updates.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of third-party registration for automation?
explanation: Third-party registration automates the registration and deregistration of services as they start or stop.

title: MicroservicesServiceDiscoveryThirdPartyRegistration - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a challenge of third-party registration for security?

options.text: External agent must authenticate with the registry

explanation: In third-party registration, the external agent must authenticate with the registry to prevent unauthorized access.

explanation: The external agent must handle registry unavailability and retry registration to maintain consistency.
